questions.question: How are elements similar to those in the same group on the periodic table?

choices.answer: They have the same number of electrons.
They have the same number of valence electrons.
They have the same number of protons.
They have the same atomic mass.

questions.question: Which choice best describes the properties of potassium (K), based on its position on the periodic table of elements?

choices.answer: a highly reactive metal
a nonreactive metal
a nonreactive nonmetal
a highly reactive nonmetal

choices.answer: HgO  Hg + O<sub>2</sub>
2Fe + O<sub>2</sub>  Fe<sub>2</sub>O<sub>3</sub>
2H<sub>2</sub> + O<sub>2  </sub>2H<sub>2</sub>O

questions.question: Which is best represented by the equation? 2Mg + O<sub>2 </sub> 2MgO

choices.answer: Law of Conservation of Energy
Law of Conservation of Mass
Law of Superposition

questions.question: A solid material is tested.  Which observation would MOST likely indicate that the material is a mixture?

choices.answer: The material has crystals of two different colors.
The material does not dissolve completely in water.
The material does not melt when it is heated over a burner.

questions.question: A student passes a magnet over 10 grams of a powder. Four grams of the powder stick to the magnet, while 6 grams do not.

choices.answer: element
mixture
compound

questions.question: Which type of matter can be separated by physical means?

choices.answer: atom
element
compound
mixture

imageMetadata.altText: Individuality concept, birds on a wire, alone against mass

questions.question: How many atoms are in one formula unit of magnesium hydroxide, Mg(OH)2
What number and types of atoms occur in a formula unit of Ca(NO3)2?

choices.answer: 1 carbon atom, 1 neon atom, and 6 oxygen atoms
1 calcium atom, 2 neon atoms, and 3 oxygen atoms
1 calcium atom, 2 nitrogen atoms, and 6 oxygen atoms
1 carbon atom, 1 nitrogen atom, and 3 oxygen atoms

imageMetadata.altText: Abstract technology circles with global connection lines. Energy recycle symbol graphic design on black background. 3d illustration

questions.question: How many atoms are in one formula unit of the compound FeC<sub>5</sub>O<sub>5</sub>?
Which of the following is an example of a compound?

choices.answer: copper
iron
water
carbon

questions.question: How many atoms of oxygen are in a molecule of glucose, C<sub>6</sub>H<sub>12</sub>O<sub>6</sub>?
When oxygen combines with hydrogen, which substance is formed?

choices.answer: water
vinegar
hydrochloric acid
hydrogen dioxide

imageMetadata.altText: Hydrogen storage tank concept in beautiful morning light. 3d rendering.

questions.question: Which substance is composed of only one type of atom?

choices.answer: water
gold
salt
sugar

questions.question: Where are the most reactive metals located on the periodic table?

choices.answer: the uppermost complete row of the table
the rows at the bottom of the table connecting two section
the column at the far left side of the table
the second column from the right side of the table

imageMetadata.altText: Silver metallic surface, Shiny metal sheet.

questions.question: Where are the most reactive nonmetals located on the periodic table?

choices.answer: the uppermost complete row of the table
the rows at the bottom of the table connecting two sections
the column at the far left side of the table
the second column from the right side of the table

imageMetadata.altText: Oxygen. Other Nonmetals. Chemical Element of Mendeleev's Periodic Table.

questions.question: Which of these is one similarity of the elements in the first group of the periodic table?

choices.answer: The elements in the group have similar atomic masses.
The elements in the group have the same number of electrons.
The elements in the group are very unreactive metals.
The elements in the group react with oxygen in similar ways.

questions.question: What was observed that led to the arrangement of 63 elements by increasing atomic weights in the periodic table?

choices.answer: A repetition occurs in chemical and physical properties.
An atomic weight corresponds to the existing abundance.
The number of neutrons and protons increased by one.
The chemical compounds formed by the elements increased by one.

questions.question: What physical property is characteristic of all of the elements in the group located in the rightmost column of the PT?

choices.answer: very high melting point
gas state at room temperature
good conductor of electric current
extremely brittle solid at room temperature

questions.question: Elements in the same column of the periodic table of the elements all

choices.answer: have the same number of protons.
share the same atomic structure.
have similar physical characteristics.
share the same number of neutrons.

imageMetadata.altText: Stone pillars row and stairs detail. Classical building facade

questions.question: Which statement BEST describes the organization of the periodic table of the elements?

choices.answer: All gases are grouped together.
Gases easily form compounds with other elements.
Elements within a group have similar properties.
Elements within a period have the same number of electrons.

questions.question: Observe lithium floating in H2O& making a buzz sound as gas bubbles formed.  The conclusion made by this observation?

choices.answer: A chemical change took place.
The lithium was dissolved by the water.
Dissolved gases were released.
Water was vaporized.

questions.question: A chip of limestone into a HCL solution, and CO2 was released. The  CO2 provided evidence that

choices.answer: only a physical change occurred.
a chemical change occurred.
only a loss of mass occurred
the formation of an element occurred.

questions.question: Bubbles and fizzing occur after adding an acid solution to a white powdery substance in a beaker. What can be inferred?

choices.answer: The acid boiled when poured into the beaker
The acid and powder formed a new product.
A physical reaction produced a gas mixture
A reaction occurred that produced heat.

imageMetadata.altText: Liquid gel or serum on microscope screen isolated background

questions.question: Which of the following observations provides evidence of a physical change?

choices.answer: using heat to burn a log in a fireplace
using light to produce sugar in plants
a cake that was baked from many ingredients
a bottle that was broken into many small pieces

imageMetadata.altText: broken cracked glass with hole in black background

questions.question: Bubbles form when water boiled. What happened to matter because of the physical change to the water?

choices.answer: New matter was created in the bubbles.
Old matter was destroyed as the water turned to gas.
Matter was conserved when it changed form.
The composition of the matter changed.

imageMetadata.altText: Grilling mushrooms, spring onion and pinenutsin a grill pan

questions.question: Which set of coefficients will balance this chemical equation?   __C<sub>2</sub>H<sub>4</sub>(g) + __O<sub>2</sub>(g) → 2CO<sub>2</sub>(g) + 2H<sub>2</sub>O(g)
How does the concept of conservation of mass apply to chemical reactions?

choices.answer: The reactants and products have exactly the same atoms.
The reactants and products have exactly the same molecules.
The change in the amount of matter is equal to the change in energy.

questions.question: Which set of coefficients will balance this chemical equation?   __PbS(s) + __O<sub>2</sub>(g) → 2PbO(s) + 2SO<sub>2</sub>(g)
What coefficient for O<sub>2</sub> demonstrates the law of conservation of mass?   CH<sub>4</sub>(g) + __O<sub>2</sub>(g) → CO<sub>2</sub>(g) + 2H<sub>2</sub>O(g)

questions.question: A chemical reaction separates H2O into H & O gases. Which of the following statements is true about the mass of the H2O?

choices.answer: The mass of the water is greater than the combined mass of the two gases.
The combined mass of the two gases is much greater than the mass of the wat
The combined mass of the two gases is the same as the mass of the water.

questions.question: What is your favorite thing to do outside of school?

choices.answer: Read
Watch TV
Play video games
hang out with friends/family
